customer_name: City and County Of San Francisco

citations.narrative:
The Perimeter fence of the bison paddock has several areas of extensive plant overgrowth adjacent to, through, and over
the chain-link fencing that do not allow for inspection of approximately 150 yards of fence-line. Not only does the
overgrowth prevent inspection as well as the ability to maintain and/or repair the fence, it also provides for potential
harborage of pests, and a potential means for unwanted animal entry to the enclosure. The outdoor housing facilities shall
be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
Correct by 9/30/23

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Although the facility does provide appropriate enrichment within the enclosures that address the requirements of this plan,
the facility did not have a documented environmental enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their
avian species as required. The plan is necessary to ensure the psychological health and well-being of the birds. A lack of
environmental enrichment can negatively impact birds health and welfare. The facility must develop, document and follow
a species appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The
plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental
enrichment, special considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan.
Correct by 9/14/23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The Perimeter fence of the bison paddock has several areas of extensive plant overgrowth adjacent to, through, and over 
the chain-link fencing that do not allow for inspection of approximately 150 yards of fence-line. Not only does the 
overgrowth prevent inspection as well as the ability to maintain and/or repair the fence, it also provides for potential 
harborage of pests, and a potential means for unwanted animal entry to the enclosure. The outdoor housing facilities shall 
be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. 
Correct by 9/30/23 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
Although the facility does provide appropriate enrichment within the enclosures that address the requirements of this plan, 
the facility did not have a documented environmental enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their 
avian species as required. The plan is necessary to ensure the psychological health and well-being of the birds. A lack of 
environmental enrichment can negatively impact birds health and welfare. The facility must develop, document and follow 
a species appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The 
plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental 
enrichment, special considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan. 
Correct by 9/14/23 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: BARN OWL / WESTERN BARN OWL / AMERICAN BARN OWL /
